quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 9 Quiz 9
quiz.subtitle: 9.9: Binomial Probability
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Calculating probabilities for sequences of independent Bernoulli trials

questions.question: A fair coin is flipped 5 times. What is the probability of getting exactly 3 heads?
A basketball player makes 80% of her free throws. If she shoots 4 free throws, what is the probability she makes exactly 3?
A multiple-choice quiz has 5 questions, each with 4 options. If a student guesses randomly on all questions, what is the probability they get exactly 2 correct?
In a binomial distribution, if the probability of success $p$ is 0.3, what is the probability of failure $q$?
A seed has a 90% germination rate. If you plant 10 seeds, which expression represents the probability that exactly 8 will grow?
questions.explanation: The formula requires the number of combinations $C(10, 8)$ multiplied by the probability of success to the power of $k$ and failure to the power of $n-k$.

questions.question: A bag contains 3 red marbles and 7 blue marbles. If a marble is picked and replaced 3 times, what is the probability of picking exactly 1 red marble?
What is the probability of getting at least 1 tail in 3 coin flips?
questions.explanation: The easiest way is to find $1 - P(0 \text{ tails})$. $P(0 \text{ tails}) = (0.5)^3 = 1/8$. $1 - 1/8 = 7/8$.

questions.question: A factory finds that 1% of its products are defective. If 5 items are chosen at random, what is the probability that none are defective?
If you roll a standard die 4 times, what is the probability of rolling exactly two 6s?
Which of the following is NOT a requirement for a Bernoulli trial?
options: The trials are dependent on each other
There are exactly two possible outcomes
The probability of success remains constant
There is a fixed number of trials
questions.explanation: Bernoulli trials must be independent. If the outcome of one trial affects the next, binomial probability cannot be used.
